summary: The video demonstrates how to create simple desktop applications with a cute aesthetic. It shows examples of an egg timer and a tic-tac-toe game, and mentions a calendar application. The creator explains that they have a full step-by-step tutorial on their YouTube channel covering setup to coding and styling, and that template code is available on GitHub. The video ends with the creator waving and saying goodbye.
creator_presence: Creator-centric, Face only, Full body, Occasional appearances
on_screen_text: Easy cute little desktop app tutorial
How to code ur first little desktop app from scratch (beginner friendly & cozy aesthetic :3)
I have a full step-by-step tutorial
Or if you just want to
IMPORTANT: Click & open README.md for full instructions
A simple ElectronJS starter template for building desktop apps
This repo is part of my YouTube tutorial on setting up your first simple, beginner-friendly, and easy to customize for any app.
This repo is a part of my Youtube tutorial on how to build a simple desktop app from scratch.
This repo is only for the basic Electron template that you'll need if you are interested in a beginner demonstration tutorial too. See the link below:
Figma design file for this project: https://www.figma.com/file/...
A simple desktop calendar app built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Electron. This repo is part of my YouTube tutorial series on building your first Electron app.

Make desktop applications.

I have a full step-by-step tutorial on my YouTube.
From how to set up everything that you'll need.

Electron app template.

A simple ElectronJS starter template for building desktop apps.

What's in this repo.
Little Calendar.
A simple desktop calendar app built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Electron. This repo is part of my YouTube tutorial series on building your first Electron app.
Happy coding!
